comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: The ads for Mark Foys and Gilbey match the ones in the Library's image by the Star Photo Co. from c. 1900-1910, so I'm going for 1905! acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=413360 EG
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
Thanks beachcomberaustralia and EG for getting us started!
- AG

comment.author: 23173353@N06
comment._content: The Mark Foys sign suggests its 1909 at the earliest

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/23173353@N06] @under_exposed - Mark Foys were trading in Oxford Street before the Liverpool Street Department Store opened.

The "T" tramway pylons were replaced c.1908 to enable wider-bodied trams.

 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw] The Star Photo Co. shows the small hut with the advert for Forest Lodge Races as seen and minutely discussed here -
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5215291939/]

I reckon c.1903 !
